title: That moment when you want your own main to be nerfed
body:
Yes, I'm obviously talking about {{champion:157}}, I'm a main with 408k mastery points on him, but I'm seeing these "mains" abusing his new ~~stupid~~ builds and having success with him without knowing how to play him properly.

And this situation sucks, because it draws unwanted attention to the champion, making him even more hated and banned, reducing my and other true mains chances of playing him (not to mention that people mistake me for those "mains", it's infuriating)

I still remember, back in patch 4.18, when Yasuo was overnerfed and his winrate was below 43% winrate, he wasn't banned and only dedicated people picked him, it was truly challenging to play him back then, but it was worth it (high risk-high reward).

So, if it takes a overnerf to get rid of those meta sheep/copycats and to remove all this attention from Yasuo, so be it.

Obligatory Skirmisher isn't a subclass but shares the same classification as Slayers with Assassins.

To be serious though, the difference between the two is pretty clear: Assassins deal high end burst but can usually only delete squishy carries or supports before having to leave less they get banged by the more durable enemies while Skirmishers can deal extremely sustained damage against anyone and everything in their path and have defensive tools in their kits to keep them in fights. They're supposed to stay in fights, not run away after killing someone. Even before the Bruiser Yasuo meta, his usual builds had him build two, sometimes one defensive items as his last items in order to avoid being easy to blow up.

Realistically though, a skirmisher is someone who jumps in on a squishy, gets their damage off and leaves because they don't have the tankiness/sustain to last in a fight. They then repeat this until the target dies.
You basically described a fighter which is moreso what yasuo is as he has the lifesteal and sheer damage to keep a sustained fight going. He can be both a fighter or a skirmisher, it just depends on your playstyle

Yes he got that wrong. Skirmisher is supposed to be melee poker, going in, doing damage and getting away. Ekko this way fits Skirmisher as he gets MS buff when he triggers his Passive. Fiora gets MS buff when she hits Vital. Yasuo can use his dash-in and dash-out pattern.

According to riot's new classification, both skirmisher and assassin are subclasses of slayer.

It's a difficult situation because there's three problems that go into this. 

1. Yasuo is unhealthy. Period.  You can argue how fun to play he is, but that's not an excuse for defending his toxic kit.

2. Keystones are bullshit.  The mastery rework this year added even more balance levers for the already incompetent balance team and introduced way too much free power for everyone, not just him.  

3.  The Triforce buff was completely unnecessary and created many more problems than it solved (the story of season 6 in a nutshell.)

Does he need nerfs?  I'd argue for a full-scale rework, but that's just me being biased. I also think keystones need removed since for how much they "spiced up" the game, they kinda ruined everything and are continuing to ruin everything in terms of balance.  Then there's Triforce...change it back?

I think they need to remove some parts of his kit. I just started playing Yasou and i have been doing decently with him, but oh my god does he have an overloaded kit. 
More crit chance (with a little tiny drawback that doesn't matter) Free shield that blocks damage from every ability including ignite that you get from WALKING, resource less,  a practically no-cd dash,tornado that knocks up and applies on hit-effects and scales off of AS, wall that blocks every projectile and destroys them, ult that keeps enemies suspended in air and deals damage while also giving him armor pen for the next 15 seconds.

You sir have a conscience. I remember wanting Karma to get nerfed a couple patches earlier and then Riot removes her ability to shield minions meanwhile Alistar is the biggest offender of healing minions.
